intro: Pleocnemia acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-tipped pleocnemia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its lanceolate, acuminate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in late summer.
